guide.title: HowTo: Make Adobe's Flash player work with Konqueror
guide.author: Elias Probst
Pariksheet Nanda
guide.abstract: A guide for Gentoo users who want to use Adobe's flash player in Konqueror.

body.p: You can use kmplayer's XEmbed to run Adobe's flash player under Konqueror.
1. Install media-video/kmplayer, and ensure you have USE="npp" set. Make sure you have the proper version installed:
2. For amd64 machines, you will either need to install net-www/nspluginwrapper or to use the native 64-bit flash >=net-www/netscape-flash-10.0.20.7_alpha
3. Run the following commands, depending on what arch you are running:
body.pre: $ kwriteconfig --file kmplayerrc --group "application/x-shockwave-flash" --key player npp $ kwriteconfig --file kmplayerrc --group "application/x-shockwave-flash" --key plugin /usr/lib/nsbrowser/plugins/libflashplayer.so

$ kwriteconfig --file kmplayerrc --group "application/x-shockwave-flash" --key player npp $ kwriteconfig --file kmplayerrc --group "application/x-shockwave-flash" --key plugin /usr/lib64/nsbrowser/plugins/npwrapper.libflashplayer.so

$ kwriteconfig --file kmplayerrc --group "application/x-shockwave-flash" --key player npp $ kwriteconfig --file kmplayerrc --group "application/x-shockwave-flash" --key plugin /usr/lib64/nsbrowser/plugins/libflashplayer.so
body.note: If you do not have 'kwriteconfig' (usually because you are using only Konqueror and not the full KDE environment) you will need to emerge kde-base/kreadconfig
body.p: 4. Open Konqueror and click Settings > Configure Konqueror. In the new window navigate to File Associations in the left-hand panel and select application/x-shockwave-flash. Click the Embedding tab and click Add... Select Embedded MPlayer for KDE from the new window. If it is not there then you may need to run kbuildsycoca from a terminal. Close all the opened windows.
Keyboard support is somewhat patchy, so some games may not function properly.
